revisions.rev:
{{Main article|Commemorative coins of Poland}} Poland has a rich selection of [[Gold]] and [[Silver]] commemorative coins. In the year 2007 coins were launched in the series: "Animals of the World", "Polish Travelers and Explorers", "History of the Polish Zloty", "Monuments of Material Culture in Poland", "History of the Polish Cavalry", "Polish Painters of the Turn of 19th and 20th Centuries" and various occasional coins. {{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/plan_2007_en.pdf | title=Schedule for Issuance of Polish COLLECTOR Coins for the Year 2008 | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-01}} {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Animals of the World:'' [[Grey seal]] (lat. Halichoerus grypus){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2007/FokaSzara_en.pdf | title=Grey seal coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-01}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Reverse designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska,
'''Obverse designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 58,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:'''
17 January 2007 {{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2007.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zl Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 2007 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|38.61|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|28.28|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 360 zÅ {{cite journal |title=Cennik monet kolekcjonerskich | journal=PrzeglÄd Numizmatyczny |publisher=Stowarzyszenie NumizmatykÃ³w Polskich - Polish Numismatic Society|volume=63/2008 |issue=4 |pages=23â26 |year=2008 |issn=1231-143X |oclc=68734851 }} |- | colspan="5" align=left | Part of the collection "Animals of the World". Obverse: An image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Under the Eagle the notation of the year of issue, 2007, below an inscription, ZÅ 20 ZÅ. The images of the national flag at the sides of the Eagle's legs. At the top, a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. The Mint's mark, under the Eagle's left leg.

Reverse: In the central part images of two adult seals and one young seal, and the shade of two seals in the background. Above the stylised sea waves. At the top, a semicircular inscription, FOKA SZARA, at the bottom, a semicircular inscription, Halichoerus grypus. |- | colspan="5" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''Polish Travelers & Explorers:''''' [[Ignacy Domeyko]] (1802-1889){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2007/domeyko_en.pdf | title=Ignacy Domeyko coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Roussanka Nowakowska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 55,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:'''
6 February 2007 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 75 zÅ |- | colspan="5" align=left | Obverse: On the left an image of the Eagle established as the state emblem of the Republic of Poland.Above a stylised image of mountains. At the top a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. Under the Eagle the inscription, 10 ZÅ, under the inscription the indication of the year of issue, 2007. On the right side of the Eagle stylised images: a fragment of a technical drawing displaying the instrument to analyse silver, crystal from the table in the mineralogy handbook by Ignacy Domeyko, plants "Domeykoa oppositifolia" and a mussel "Trigonia domeykoana". The Mint's mark, under the Eagle's left leg.

Reverse: On the left a stylised image of seated Ignacy Domeyko with an open book. Above on the left and on the right side a stylised image of mountains. On the right side stylised images of the fragments of a geographic grid and the outline of South America. On the right side a semicircular inscription, IGNACY DOMEYKO 1802-1889. |- | colspan="5" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 75th Anniversary of Breaking [[Enigma machine|Enigma Codes]] (gold){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2007/enigma_en.pdf | title=75th Anniversary of Breaking Enigma Codes coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 100 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 8,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:'''
21 March 2007 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|21.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|8|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 800 zÅ |- | colspan="5" align=left | Obverse: In the central part, an image of the Eagle established as the state emblem of the Republic of Poland. In the background, tables of letters and an outline of the Enigma cipher machine operation diagram. A semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, the notation of the year of issue, 2007 and an inscription, 100 ZÅ. The Mintâs mark, incorporated into the tables of letters, under the Eagleâs left leg.

Reverse: On the left and on the right, stylised light bulbs from the Enigma cipher machine, surrounded by two groups of circles reflecting beams of light. At the top, in three rows, letters of the alphabet connected by lines with two rows of letters below. Under the light bulbs, an inscription, 75. ROCZNICA ZÅAMANIA/ SZYFRU ENIGMY (75th anniversary of breaking Enigma codes). |- | colspan="5" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 75th Anniversary of Breaking [[Enigma machine|Enigma Codes]] (silver) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 52,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:'''
21 March 2007 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 75 zÅ |- | colspan="5" align=left | Obverse: An image of the Eagle established as the state emblem of the Republic of Poland. Above the Eagle, an inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA/ POLSKA. In the background, a stylised Enigma cipher machine operation diagram and a stylised inscription, ENIGMA, emerging from the composition of lines. Under the diagram, on the left, the notation of the year of issue, 2007. At the bottom, an inscription, 10 ZÅ. The Mintâs mark under the Eagleâs left leg.

Reverse: A stylised labyrinth of connections referring to the operation of the Enigma cipher machine. In the centre, an inscription, ENIGMA. Below, an inscription, 1932, inverted by 180 degrees. In the rim, an inscription, 75. ROCZNICA ZÅAMANIA SZYFRU ENIGMY (75th anniversary of breaking Enigma codes).

On the edge: An inscription, MARIAN REJEWSKI, HENRYK ZYGALSKI, JERZY RÃÅ»YCKI, separated by stars. |- | colspan="5" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''History of the Polish Zloty:'' 5 zloty of 1928 issue ([[Nike_(mythology)|Nike]]){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2007/dz_en.pdf | title=History of the Polish Zloty: 5 zloty of 1928 issue (Nike) coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Andrzej Nowakowski | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 52,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:'''

Above the Eagle, the notation of the year of issue, 2007. At the bottom, a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. Under the Eagle's left leg, the mint's mark: m/w.

Reverse: On the right-hand side, an image of the reverse of the 5 zl coin of 1928. In the background, a stylised image of grain ears. Reverse: On the left, the stylised image of Prince [[Boleslaus_the_Shy|Boleslaw the Shy]] as painted by [[Jan Matejko]]. On the right, a stylised image of the Prince's seal and the first words from the incorporation charter of [[KrakÃ³w]] in Latin. Below the Eagle an inscription, 10 ZÅ. At the top, a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and on the left, diagonally below the inscription, the notation of the year of issue, 2007. To the left from the Eagle, a stylised "Belgica" ship image, below, a stylised iceberg image and an ice-imitating zirconia. The Mint's mark, m/w, under the Eagle's left leg.

Reverse: Images of the busts of Henryk Arctowski and Antoni B. Dobrowolski. At the bottom, on the left, the image of the Antarctic continent. At the top, a stylised image of an iceberg. In the rim, an inscription, HENRYK ARCTOWSKI 1871-1958, a stylised image of Henryk Arctowski Polish Antarctic Station logo and an inscription, ANTONI B. Below the Eagle, an inscription, 200 ZÅ.Between the beginning and the end of the inscription - a dot. The Mint's mark, m/w, under the Eagle's left leg.

Around the Eagle an inscription, 20 zÅ, a separating dot, an inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and the notation of the year of issue, 2007. The Mintâs mark, m/w, under the Eagleâs left leg.

Reverse: An image of Leon WyczÃ³Åkowski, in accordance with the self-portrait of 1927. In the left-hand bottom corner, a palette and three paint brushes. On the palette paints: red, yellow, green and blue. On the left-hand side and above an inscription, LEON WYCZÃÅKOWSKI, on the right-hand side a vertical inscription, 1852â1936. |- | colspan="5" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[Joseph Conrad|Konrad Korzeniowski]]/[[Joseph Conrad]] (gold){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2007/conrad_en.pdf | title= Joseph Conrad coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-03}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 8,200 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:'''

Reverse: An image of Joseph Conrad, on its right-hand side an inscription, 1857-1924. Below an inscription, JOSEPH CONRAD, against the background of the stylized facsimile of his signature. Below, a hologram shows the reflection of the barque in water and changes colours depending on the angle of vision. |- | colspan="5" |   |} ==See also== * [[Numismatics]] * [[Regular issue coinage]] * [[Coin grading]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Polish currency and coinage}} [[Category:Commemorative coins of Poland]]
